intro: Psychotria flavens, commonly known as the yellow psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, often found in moist, shaded forest understories. Its leaves are usually elliptical and glossy, while its flowers are clustered in cymes. Psychotria flavens is also known for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic uses.
